forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 4am, then a chance of rain showers between 4am and 5am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind around 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As daylight wanes over Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere embraces a shroud of muted tones—a canvas of mostly gray, complemented by fleeting hints of blue. The high temperature, barely scraping into the upper 50s, indicates a day that has struggled against the chill of the Pacific breezes. Gusts swirl at times, giving a hint of unpredictability, while the gentle promise of rain looms for the evening, urging those outdoors to anticipate a brief companionship with the clouds before midnight approaches.

This late afternoon presents an oddly pleasant scene; despite the overcast sky, there is an undeniable charm in the air, imbued with the scent of impending moisture. The marine layer casts its soft embrace across the hills and the bay, hinting at areas where fog may linger, teasing visibility beyond the immediate surroundings. Dress in layers—perhaps a light jacket to ward off the wind, accompanied by a scarf to ward off the chill. As the chance of a rain shower dances around 40%, a well-placed umbrella wouldn't go amiss either. Given the conditions, a comforting cup of coffee at a local café along the Embarcadero could be a delightful way to shelter from the elements, or perhaps a stroll through the quieter streets of the city, where the charm of San Francisco thrives in the twilight glow of the day, punctuated by the glow of street lamps and distant laughter.
